reviews.review_msg: Probably the worst professor at SFU. Do not take this class.

He is just so good looking. Wow. That is the only reason I am in his class, but he is nice and because he is good looking everything sounds so much better and makes so much more sense. I would so recommend him.

engaging, charismatic, and why not, kinda cute.  however, all the personality in the world cannot make this man lecture clearly and effectively.  there is a lot of historical and textual context to take in, organization is key.  power points full of pictures does not help.  hurrah for james, blah for professor acken.

A very dynamic professor, easily captures your attention, never a dull moment in class.  Has a very wide range of knowledge which he uses effectively to help you understand the material as well as the time period from which it comes.  Fascinating, highly recommend ANY class taught by him.
Horrible teacher. Petty and small--her pedagogy is highly dubious.
No way, she is so nice. She may appear to be mean but you should overlook that and concentrate on her teaching. She is a great instructor.

The sound of her name literally makes me shudder. She expects graduate level writing for a 200 level course. Her comments on essays are mocking, cruel and generally uncalled for and don't bother asking her for help either. STAY AWAY!!!
No Comments

Energetic, dynamic, and intelligent. A bit disorganized but makes up for it with her fun and engaging lectures. Amount of work and reading was just right. Challenging but definetly not boring! One of the best profs I have encountered so far.

Excellent prof!! Anne has passion for what she teaches and does a good job making literature something more than just words. Really makes the course rich and goes beyond the core material touching linguistics, history, humanities, and philosophy. Just a delightful prof.
She is slightly scatterbrained but funny.  She really seems to love the material and it shows.  She sort of makes the students want to love it as much as she does which is nice.
An amazingly knowledgeable prof with a big heart

She was a nice lady and I`m sure if only she could get her head screwed on straight she`d be a good prof.  She was interesting, but she`d go off on tangents, repeat lectures, adding 5 minutes of new material at the end, and change the syllabus a lot!
World's slowest marker.  Told us our papers would be ready for last week - still not.
Disorganized, inconsistent, unreliable, slow marker, goes off topic, unavailable, overall poor course
Terrible professor. He has a condescending manner, and is notoriously difficult to track down.. even during office hours. Run away!
Dr. DeRoo is enthusiastic and his lectures are both interesting and entertaining.  He has a commanding voice (in both English and Old Norse), and an engaging personality.  Highly recommended.

This class is difficult; do not let the other people defy you. Dr. Hussey is kind, comical, and passionate about his topic, however he is very well aware of how knowledgeable he is about medival literature, and how little you are, if you know what I mean. He expects extremely intelligent papers from second years; I think his expectations are too hi
No Comments

Matt is probably the best English prof I've had at SFU. He is very engaging - anyone who can make Old English relevant to the 21st century and comical too - is a genius. He's very knowledgable and helpful, and fun to look at. :)

"Learning about Chaucer from Sheila is the equivalent of having Jesus teach you the New Testament" (see previous comment) -- who writes this stuff?!? Sheila may be an accomplished scholar, but she's not a great professor. Avoid her class if possible.
A very rude professor.  She picks on students and tries to make them feel small.  The worst professor I have ever had at SFU.  I do not recommend her at all.

Serioulsy, LEAVE YOUR OVERHEAD ON! Delany would write something on the overhead and as soon as she finishes writing, she would turn it off. Be prepared to take a lot of notes on your own base on her scattered lectures. And don't ask questions once and for all to avoid humiliation.

albeit she knows her stuff, but she's very stuck in her opinions and God help you if you have an opinion different than hers and decide to voice it in class.  she would interrupt people who were speaking in class if their pronunciation was a tiny bit off.

Definitly recommend this class.  His lectures are interesting and funny.  His tutorials are a blast, it is amazing how much he knows.  Try anything to get in this class!  Not a hard marker on essays either.
